definition: to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: And her husband, and is XuJiaHui man living, is the child his dad.
sentences.chinese: 而徐嘉惠是丈夫，是过日子的人，是孩子他爹。

sentences.english: For years, Spindler survived mostly off savings from his consulting work.
sentences.chinese: 多年来，他主要依靠原先做咨询工作时的积蓄过日子。

sentences.english: A lot of people live their lives having no clue what they want.
sentences.chinese: 很多人浑浑噩噩过日子，不清楚自己想要什么。

sentences.english: The poor man at last was eased and hence lived happily.
sentences.chinese: 这个可怜的人终于安下心来，快快活活地过日子了。
达赖一贯靠说谎过日子。

sentences.english: Modelling was something that I got into because I just didn't want to wear a suit and tie for a living.
sentences.chinese: 咱可不想穿个西装打个领带摆各种姿势过日子。

sentences.english: Out in the sticks? Don't be nuts.
sentences.chinese: 在那种不毛之地过日子？你别傻了。

sentences.english: People just want to get along with their work and their life, and don’t want to get bothered.
sentences.chinese: 人们只是想好好地过日子，不想被那些事扰乱生活。

sentences.english: Take him away and give me my monkey back. I can do without donkeys like him.
sentences.chinese: 把它牵走，把钱还给我，我没有这样的驴也能过日子。

sentences.english: When the food ran out we had to pull in our belt.
sentences.chinese: 没有食物时，我们必须勒紧裤带过日子。

sentences.english: The Tanglin Club is a bore she can do without.
sentences.chinese: 坦格林俱乐部讨厌得很，她没有它也能过日子。

sentences.english: Could not look like formerly such ignorant living again at least.
sentences.chinese: 至少不能再像从前那样浑噩地过日子。

sentences.english: He that lives upon Hope, dies farting.
sentences.chinese: 凡靠希望过日子的人，将会绝粮而死。

sentences.english: Since the husband wallows in the net swims, she decides to let the husband swim with the net get along.
sentences.chinese: 既然丈夫沉溺网游，她决定让丈夫同网游过日子。

sentences.english: You know that nine out of ten con-men end up spending empty bitter lives as chiropractors ?
sentences.chinese: 骗子的下场十有八九只能靠按摩过日子。

definition: to live one's life/to make a living
simple life
to join up with sb/to become partner/to take meals regularly in cafeteria
to bring together/to make do in a bad situation/to just get by/to improvise/passable/not too bad
to pass one's days/to scratch out a difficult, meager existence
to housekeep/housekeeping
wife, kids and a warm bed (idiom)/the simple and good life
pinyin: lao3 po2 hai2 zi5 re4 kang4 tou5

definition: (for) a lifetime
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
tight (i.e. lacking money)/hard up/same as 緊巴巴|紧巴巴
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
food and clothing
lit. firewood, rice, oil and salt/fig. life's daily necessities
to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
husband and wife
to marry/to get married/CL:次[ci4]
